intro: Hieracium breviscapum, commonly known as the short-horned hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium breviscapum is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in agricultural and natural areas.
